name: Introduction to Neuroscience
description: A course introducing the fundamentals of neuroscience, including the structure and function of neurons, the anatomy of the nervous system, and the fundamental principles of neuroscience.

name: Neuroanatomy I
description: A course focusing on the structural organization of the human nervous system. Topics may include neuroanatomy, histology, and neurophysiology.

name: Neuroanatomy II
description: A continuation of Neuroanatomy I, focusing on the anatomy of the central and peripheral nervous systems.

name: Neural Development
description: A course covering the development of the nervous system, from embryogenesis to adulthood.

name: Cellular Neurophysiology
description: A course covering the physiology of the neuron, including topics such as action potentials, synaptic transmission, and electrical properties of cells.

name: Systems Neuroscience I
description: A course focusing on the structure and function of the nervous system, including topics such as sensory systems, motor systems, and brain plasticity.

name: Systems Neuroscience II
description: A continuation of Systems Neuroscience I, focusing on higher-level topics such as cognition, emotion, and behavior.

name: Behavioral Neuroscience
description: A course focusing on the relationship between brain systems and behavior, including topics such as learning and memory, motivation, and decision-making.
